How does Verus support the launch of new blockchains and their associated liquidity pools, and what features does it offer for crowdfunding and interoperability?

Verus provides a robust platform for launching new blockchains and their associated liquidity pools, offering a range of features to support crowdfunding, interoperability, and scalability.

**Simultaneous Blockchain and Liquidity Pool Launches:**
Verus enables the simultaneous launch of a new blockchain and a fully decentralized or centralized bridge converter liquidity pool. This bridge converter liquidity pool is bound to the launch of the new blockchain, runs on the new blockchain, and earns fees through cross-chain fee conversions or general use of the liquidity pool. Notably, these fees are earned on the new blockchain, with no rent going back to the Verus blockchain, ensuring seamless connectivity.

**Blockchain-based Crowdfunding Currency Launches:**
Verus offers a crowdfunding mechanism for new blockchain launches, allowing users to set required minimum levels of worldwide participation in their preferred currencies on-chain. If these minimums are not met by the start time of the blockchain, all participants will automatically receive a refund of all their pre-conversions, minus network fees. Additionally, launch options provide for maximum participation in one or more currencies, pre-launch discounts, price-neutral pre-allocations to select IDs, and pre-launch discounts for early participants. Using VerusIDs, launches can also include vesting schedules in the pre-allocations.

**Interoperable, Multichain Network:**
Verus operates as a multichain network, enabling the creation of an unlimited number of interoperable blockchains. Notary IDs, specified at chain definition, provide decentralized blockchain-specific bridge confirmation, allowing public blockchains to be made available for merge mining and staking. This facilitates the creation of new use cases and unlimited scale, making Verus an attractive platform for developers and users alike.
